title: Can I create a new topic, write something useless, tag it with that topic, view it once or twice, and get most viewed writer in that topic? - Quora

response.answer_text: No. Not every topic has a list of most viewed writers. Your made-up topic with only one question and one follower won’t have most viewed writers. There’s also a good chance that it will get deleted, if it’s just a nonsense topic. What determines whether a Quora topic has a “Most viewed writers” statistic associated with it?

There appears to be a critical mass of some kind below which Quora doesn’t bother with most-viewed writers. I’ve noticed that I’ve got a number of answers in some low-volume but very real topics, and they don’t maintain most-viewed lists.
